text: We'd wager that you've noticed at some point during the last couple of weeks that it's summer. And for gamers, this means only one thing... well ok, actually two: unbearable levels of heat from the magical orb in the sky, and droughts. So at Eurogamer we get to struggle on playing through some of videogaming's most hideous bargain bin abominations - just about the only type of game to hit the shelves until things pick up again in time for Christmas. Play It is a publisher attempting to coax you back indoors with a series of super-budget titles, three of which we've reviewed here. Sadly, there's a good reason these all retail for a tenner...
